quiz_questions.question: When was Dr. José Rizal born?
quiz_questions.explanation: José Rizal was born on June 19, 1861, in Calamba, Laguna. He was the seventh of eleven children.

quiz_questions.question: Where was Rizal executed?
quiz_questions.explanation: Rizal was executed by firing squad at Bagumbayan Field (now known as Luneta or Rizal Park) on December 30, 1896.

quiz_questions.question: What does 'Noli Me Tangere' mean in English?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Noli Me Tangere' is Latin for 'Touch Me Not,' taken from the Bible when Jesus spoke to Mary Magdalene after his resurrection.

quiz_questions.question: In which city was 'Noli Me Tangere' published?
quiz_questions.explanation: Noli Me Tangere was published in Berlin, Germany on February 21, 1887, with financial help from Maximo Viola.

quiz_questions.question: How many languages could Rizal speak fluently?
quiz_questions.explanation: Rizal was a polyglot who could speak 22 languages, including Spanish, French, German, English, Italian, Japanese, and various Filipino languages.

quiz_questions.question: What was Rizal's profession?
quiz_questions.explanation: Rizal was a licensed physician who specialized in ophthalmology. He studied under renowned eye doctors in Paris and Germany.

quiz_questions.question: To whom did Rizal dedicate 'El Filibusterismo'?
quiz_questions.explanation: El Filibusterismo was dedicated to GOMBURZA - Fathers Mariano Gómez, José Burgos, and Jacinto Zamora, who were executed in 1872.

quiz_questions.question: Where was Rizal exiled from 1892 to 1896?
quiz_questions.explanation: Rizal was exiled to Dapitan, a remote town in Zamboanga del Norte, where he practiced medicine, taught, and contributed to community development.

quiz_questions.question: What was Rizal's final poem called?
quiz_questions.explanation: Mi Último Adiós (My Last Farewell) was written on the eve of his execution, December 29, 1896, expressing his love for the Philippines.

quiz_questions.question: What organization did Rizal found in 1892?
quiz_questions.explanation: Rizal founded La Liga Filipina on July 3, 1892, a civic organization aimed at uniting Filipinos and advocating for peaceful reforms.

quiz_questions.question: Who was the main protagonist in 'Noli Me Tangere'?
quiz_questions.explanation: Crisostomo Ibarra is the protagonist of Noli Me Tangere, an idealistic young Filipino who returns from Europe hoping to reform society through education.

quiz_questions.question: What was Rizal's age when he was executed?
quiz_questions.explanation: Rizal was only 35 years old when he was executed on December 30, 1896.

quiz_questions.question: In 'El Filibusterismo', who is Simoun?
options: A new character unrelated to Noli
quiz_questions.explanation: Simoun is actually Crisostomo Ibarra in disguise, who survived and returned seeking revenge against the colonial system.

quiz_questions.question: What school did Rizal attend in Manila from 1872-1877?
options: Colegio de San Juan de Letran
quiz_questions.explanation: Rizal studied at Ateneo Municipal de Manila from 1872-1877, graduating with highest honors (Sobresaliente).

quiz_questions.question: Which country did Rizal visit where he fell in love with O-Sei-San?
quiz_questions.explanation: Rizal visited Japan in 1888 and fell in love with Seiko Usui (O-Sei-San), a Japanese woman. He admired Japanese culture and modernization.

quiz_questions.question: What were Rizal's last words before execution?
quiz_questions.explanation: Rizal's last words were reportedly 'Consummatum est' (It is finished), the same words Jesus spoke on the cross.

quiz_questions.question: Who helped finance the publication of 'Noli Me Tangere'?
quiz_questions.explanation: Maximo Viola, Rizal's friend, provided financial assistance to publish Noli Me Tangere in Berlin in 1887.

quiz_questions.question: What does 'El Filibusterismo' mean in English?
quiz_questions.explanation: El Filibusterismo translates to 'The Reign of Greed,' though the title also refers to subversive or revolutionary activities.

quiz_questions.question: Where did Rizal write 'El Filibusterismo'?
quiz_questions.explanation: Rizal completed and published El Filibusterismo in Ghent, Belgium on September 18, 1891.

quiz_questions.question: What was the name of Rizal's mother?
quiz_questions.explanation: Rizal's mother was Teodora Alonso Realonda, a highly educated woman who was his first teacher.

quiz_questions.question: What tragic character in Noli Me Tangere went insane after losing her sons?
quiz_questions.explanation: Sisa went insane after her two sons, Basilio and Crispín, disappeared. She symbolizes the suffering of Filipino mothers under colonial oppression.

quiz_questions.question: In what year did the execution of GOMBURZA occur?
quiz_questions.explanation: GOMBURZA were executed on February 17, 1872. This event deeply influenced young Rizal and awakened his nationalist consciousness.

quiz_questions.question: What species were named after Rizal?
options: A flying lizard and a frog
quiz_questions.explanation: Several species were named after Rizal, including Draco rizali (a flying lizard) and Rhacophorus rizali (a frog), discovered during his exile in Dapitan.

quiz_questions.question: Who was Rizal's common-law wife during his exile in Dapitan?
quiz_questions.explanation: Josephine Bracken, an Irish woman, became Rizal's common-law wife in 1895 when she came to Dapitan with her adoptive father seeking treatment.

quiz_questions.question: What was Rizal's first prize-winning poem written at age 18?
quiz_questions.explanation: A La Juventud Filipina (To the Filipino Youth) won first prize in 1879, urging Filipino youth to use their talents for the nation's betterment.

quiz_questions.question: What did Rizal build in Dapitan to help the community?
options: A water system using bamboo pipes
quiz_questions.explanation: Rizal designed and built a water system using bamboo pipes to provide clean water to Dapitan, along with other civic projects.

quiz_questions.question: Which European city's museum did Rizal spend time researching Philippine history?
quiz_questions.explanation: Rizal spent considerable time at the British Museum in London researching Philippine history and annotating Morga's historical work.

quiz_questions.question: What was the name of the ship Rizal took on his first voyage to Europe?
quiz_questions.explanation: Rizal left Manila aboard the Spanish steamer SS Salvadora on May 3, 1882, traveling under the name José Mercado.

quiz_questions.question: Who was the corrupt friar antagonist in Noli Me Tangere?
quiz_questions.explanation: Padre Dámaso is the main friar antagonist in Noli Me Tangere, representing colonial arrogance, abuse, and hypocrisy. He was also María Clara's biological father.

quiz_questions.question: What year was Rizal declared the national hero of the Philippines?
quiz_questions.explanation: In 1901, the American colonial government officially declared Rizal as the national hero of the Philippines.
